General advice: the only way to build confidence is to get out of your comfort zone. The more you push yourself to get out there and break your shell, the easier it gets to mingle with others. Join whatever activities interest you and talk to people. Don't think about how they'll perceive you. Introduce yourself to people and begin a conversation. If you're looking for conversation topics, talk about the activity you're both in and so on. You're just going to have to be yourself after coming out of your shell. 

If you're looking for friendship with women, the first thing you need to do is treat them like humans (like you treat other men) and not some mystical beings or a chamber of secrets that you need to unlock. There's no special secret or key here. Just be normal and don't be pretentious. Treat them how you'd treat any of your guy friends, discuss the same things etc. They aren't looking for anything different. If you treat them as human and like any of your other friends, odds are they'll reciprocate the friendship. And ofc but extremely important - don't go in with the wrong intentions/expectations. If you want something more, then be clear from the beginning. Nobody wants to have a friend with ulterior motives.
